page.title: 01PERTH AT A GLANCE
page.content:
Perth lies on the banks of the{River {Tay}in eastern Scotland.It has a twin town in Germany called Aschaffenburg. To the north east lie the{SIDLAW HILLS with{KINNOULL HILL}overlooking the town.To the south are the{OCHIL HILLS creating a valley site which forms the {GATEWAY TO THE HIGHLANDS.} The town's history dates back to Roman times when there was only a small camp named{BERTHA;}now Perth has about 47,000 inhabitants.The Romans claimed that the river was good for salmon fishing; it is still so today. Perth is often referred to as{THE {FAIR CITY}perhaps because Sir Walter Scott wrote{'THE FAIR MAID OF PERTH'.} For many years Perth was the capital of Scotland and monarchs were crowned at nearby Scone
